ticket|additional_collaborators.description: An array of numeric IDs, emails, or objects containing name and email properties. See [Setting Collaborators](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/tickets/#setting-collaborators). An email notification is sent to them when the ticket is updated

ticket|assignee_email.description: The email address of the agent to assign the ticket to

ticket|assignee_id.description: The agent currently assigned to the ticket

ticket|attribute_value_ids.description: An array of the IDs of attribute values to be associated with the ticket

ticket|collaborator_ids.description: The ids of users currently CC'ed on the ticket

system.client: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_12_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/61.0.3163.100 Safari/537.36

items.description: A file represented as an [Attachment](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-attachments/) object

content_type.description: The content type of the image. Example value: "image/png"

content_url.description: A full URL where the attachment image file can be downloaded. The file may be hosted externally so take care not to inadvertently send Zendesk authentication credentials. See [Working with url properties](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/working-with-url-properties)

deleted.description: If true, the attachment has been deleted

file_name.description: The name of the image file

height.description: The height of the image file in pixels. If height is unknown, returns null

inline.description:
If true, the attachment is excluded from the attachment list and the attachment's URL
can be referenced within the comment of a ticket. Default is false

malware_access_override.description: If true, you can download an attachment flagged as malware. If false, you can't download such an attachment.

malware_scan_result.description: The result of the malware scan. There is a delay between the time the attachment is uploaded and when the malware scan is completed. Usually the scan is done within a few seconds, but high load conditions can delay the scan results. Possible values: "malware_found", "malware_not_found", "failed_to_scan", "not_scanned"

mapped_content_url.description: The URL the attachment image file has been mapped to

size.description: The size of the image file in bytes

url.description: A URL to access the attachment details

width.description: The width of the image file in pixels. If width is unknown, returns null

thumbnails.description: An array of attachment objects. Note that photo thumbnails do not have thumbnails

content_type.description: The content type of the image. Example value: "image/png"

content_url.description: A full URL where the attachment image file can be downloaded. The file may be hosted externally so take care not to inadvertently send Zendesk authentication credentials. See [Working with url properties](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/working-with-url-properties)

deleted.description: If true, the attachment has been deleted

file_name.description: The name of the image file

height.description: The height of the image file in pixels. If height is unknown, returns null

inline.description:
If true, the attachment is excluded from the attachment list and the attachment's URL
can be referenced within the comment of a ticket. Default is false

malware_access_override.description: If true, you can download an attachment flagged as malware. If false, you can't download such an attachment.

malware_scan_result.description: The result of the malware scan. There is a delay between the time the attachment is uploaded and when the malware scan is completed. Usually the scan is done within a few seconds, but high load conditions can delay the scan results. Possible values: "malware_found", "malware_not_found", "failed_to_scan", "not_scanned"

mapped_content_url.description: The URL the attachment image file has been mapped to

size.description: The size of the image file in bytes

url.description: A URL to access the attachment details

width.description: The width of the image file in pixels. If width is unknown, returns null

audit_id.description: The id of the ticket audit record. See [Show Audit](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket_audits/#show-audit)

author_id.description: The id of the comment author. See [Author id](#author-id)

created_at.description: The time the comment was created

html_body.description: The comment formatted as HTML. See [Bodies](#bodies)

id.description: Automatically assigned when the comment is created

metadata.description: System information (web client, IP address, etc.) and comment flags, if any. See [Comment flags](#comment-flags)

plain_body.description: The comment presented as plain text. See [Bodies](#bodies)

public.description: true if a public comment; false if an internal note. The initial value set on ticket creation persists for any additional comment unless you change it

type.description: `Comment` or `VoiceComment`. The JSON object for adding voice comments to tickets is different. See [Adding voice comments to tickets](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/adding-voice-comments-to-tickets)

uploads.description: List of tokens received from [uploading files](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/ticket-attachments/#upload-files) for comment attachments. The files are attached by creating or updating tickets with the tokens. See [Attaching files](/api-reference/ticketing/tickets/tickets/#attaching-files) in Tickets

via.description: Describes how the object was created. See the [Via object reference](/documentation/ticketing/reference-guides/via-object-reference)

channel.description: This tells you how the ticket or event was created. Examples: "web", "mobile", "rule", "system"

source.description: For some channels a source object gives more information about how or why the ticket or event was created

ticket|custom_fields.description: Custom fields for the ticket. See [Setting custom field values](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-custom-field-values)

ticket|custom_status_id.description: The custom ticket status id of the ticket. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses)

ticket|due_at.description: If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date.  Due date format uses [ISO 8601](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format.

ticket|email_ccs.description: An array of objects that represent agent or end users email CCs to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting email CCs](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-email-ccs)

ticket|external_id.description: An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records

ticket|followers.description: An array of objects that represent agent followers to add or delete from the ticket. See [Setting followers](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-followers)

ticket|group_id.description: The group this ticket is assigned to

ticket|organization_id.description: The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See [Organization Memberships](/api-reference/ticketing/organizations/organization_memberships/)

ticket|priority.description: The urgency with which the ticket should be addressed.

ticket|problem_id.description: For tickets of type "incident", the ID of the problem the incident is linked to

ticket|requester_id.description: The user who requested this ticket

ticket|safe_update.description: Optional boolean. Prevents updates with outdated ticket data (`updated_stamp` property required when true)

ticket|sharing_agreement_ids.description: An array of the numeric IDs of sharing agreements. Note that this replaces any existing agreements

ticket|status.description:
The state of the ticket.

If your account has activated custom ticket statuses, this is the ticket's
status category. See [custom ticket statuses](#custom-ticket-statuses).

ticket|subject.description: The value of the subject field for this ticket

ticket|tags.description: The array of tags applied to this ticket

ticket|updated_stamp.description: Datetime of last update received from API. See the safe_update property

ticket|additional_collaborators.label: Ticket Additional Collaborators
ticket|additional_collaborators.tooltip:
An array of numeric IDs, emails, or objects containing name and email properties. See Setting Collaborators. An email notification is sent to them when the ticket is updated
JSON array. Example: [{"email":"someone@example.com","name":"Someone Special"}].

ticket|assignee_email.label: Ticket Assignee Email
ticket|assignee_email.tooltip:
The email address of the agent to assign the ticket to
JSON array. Example: "IiP55TTFBr@WltQizth.fqyn".

ticket|assignee_id.label: Ticket Assignee Id
ticket|assignee_id.tooltip:
The agent currently assigned to the ticket
JSON array. Example: -68756168.

ticket|attribute_value_ids.label: Ticket Attribute Value Ids
ticket|attribute_value_ids.tooltip:
An array of the IDs of attribute values to be associated with the ticket
JSON array. Example: [-15988909].

ticket|collaborator_ids.label: Ticket Collaborator Ids
ticket|collaborator_ids.tooltip:
The ids of users currently CC'ed on the ticket
JSON array. Example: [].

ticket|comment.label: Ticket Comment
ticket|comment.tooltip: Example: {"attachments":[{"contenttype":"text/plain","contenturl":"https://company.zendesk.com/attachments/crash.log","filename":"crash.log","id":498483,"size":2532,"thumbnails":[]}],"authorid":123123,"body":"Thanks for your help!","createdat":"2009-07-20T22:55:29Z","id":1274,"metadata":{"system":{"client":"Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10126) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/61.0.3163.100 Safari/537.36","ipaddress":"1.1.1.1","latitude":-37.000000000001,"location":"Melbourne, 07, Australia","longitude":144.0000000000002},"via":{"channel":"web","source":{"from":{},"rel":"web_widget","to":{}}}},"public":true,"type":"Comment"}

ticket|custom_fields.label: Ticket Custom Fields
ticket|custom_fields.tooltip:
Custom fields for the ticket. See Setting custom field values
JSON array. Example: [].

ticket|custom_status_id.label: Ticket Custom Status Id
ticket|custom_status_id.tooltip:
The custom ticket status id of the ticket. See custom ticket statuses
JSON array. Example: 13565546.

ticket|due_at.label: Ticket Due At
ticket|due_at.tooltip:
If this is a ticket of type "task" it has a due date. Due date format uses ISO 8601 format.
JSON array. Example: "1926-01-18T13:05:01.0Z".

ticket|email_ccs.label: Ticket Email Ccs
ticket|email_ccs.tooltip:
An array of objects that represent agent or end users email CCs to add or delete from the ticket. See Setting email CCs
JSON array. Example: [{"action":"put","useremail":"hF1r9n9nPbcMN@LY.ajfp","userid":"nulla enim amet","user_name":"et pariatur"}].

ticket|external_id.label: Ticket External Id
ticket|external_id.tooltip:
An id you can use to link Zendesk Support tickets to local records
JSON array. Example: "id commodo nulla cillum occaecat".

ticket|followers.label: Ticket Followers
ticket|followers.tooltip:
An array of objects that represent agent followers to add or delete from the ticket. See Setting followers
JSON array. Example: [{"action":"put","useremail":"QC8PDtT-wFSxsGv@cUMTNYspoYGGZsOQUqIvmeXlFLnTj.ggd","userid":"amet"}].

ticket|group_id.label: Ticket Group Id
ticket|group_id.tooltip:
The group this ticket is assigned to
JSON array. Example: -31043495.

ticket|organization_id.label: Ticket Organization Id
ticket|organization_id.tooltip:
The organization of the requester. You can only specify the ID of an organization associated with the requester. See Organization Memberships
JSON array. Example: 4638679.

ticket|priority.label: Ticket Priority
ticket|priority.tooltip:
The urgency with which the ticket should be addressed.
JSON array. Example: "high".

ticket|problem_id.label: Ticket Problem Id
ticket|problem_id.tooltip:
For tickets of type "incident", the ID of the problem the incident is linked to
JSON array. Example: 67680360.

ticket|requester_id.label: Ticket Requester Id
ticket|requester_id.tooltip:
The user who requested this ticket
JSON array. Example: -40939718.

ticket|safe_update.label: Ticket Safe Update
ticket|safe_update.tooltip:
Optional boolean. Prevents updates with outdated ticket data (updated_stamp property required when true)
JSON array. Example: true.

ticket|sharing_agreement_ids.label: Ticket Sharing Agreement Ids
ticket|sharing_agreement_ids.tooltip:
An array of the numeric IDs of sharing agreements. Note that this replaces any existing agreements
JSON array. Example: [-33112827].

ticket|status.label: Ticket Status
ticket|status.tooltip:
The state of the ticket.

If your account has activated custom ticket statuses, this is the ticket's status category. See custom ticket statuses.
JSON array. Example: "new".

ticket|subject.label: Ticket Subject
ticket|subject.tooltip:
The value of the subject field for this ticket
JSON array. Example: "nostrud voluptate aute cupidatat sunt".

ticket|tags.label: Ticket Tags
ticket|tags.tooltip:
The array of tags applied to this ticket
JSON array. Example: [].

ticket|type.label: Ticket Type
ticket|type.tooltip:
The type of this ticket.
JSON array. Example: "question".

ticket|updated_stamp.label: Ticket Updated Stamp
ticket|updated_stamp.tooltip:
Datetime of last update received from API. See the safe_update property
JSON array. Example: "1946-06-01T16:30:51.0Z".

schema.description: Write only. An array of the IDs of attribute values to be associated with the ticket
The ids of users currently CC'ed on the ticket
POST requests only. Users to add as cc's when creating a ticket. See [Setting Collaborators](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-collaborators)
Custom fields for the ticket. See [Setting custom field values](/documentation/ticketing/managing-tickets/creating-and-updating-tickets#setting-custom-field-values)
The ids of agents or end users currently CC'ed on the ticket. See [CCs and followers resources](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020585233) in the Support Help Center
The ids of agents currently following the ticket. See [CCs and followers resources](https://support.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360020585233)
The ids of the followups created from this ticket. Ids are only visible once the ticket is closed
POST requests only. List of macro IDs to be recorded in the ticket audit
The ids of the sharing agreements used for this ticket
The array of tags applied to this ticket
